thread.title: Cricket-England spinner Crane out of NZ tests with back fracture

title: Cricket-England spinner Crane out of NZ tests with back fracture
text: March 16, 2018 / 7:57 AM / Updated 10 hours ago Cricket: England spinner Crane out of NZ tests with back fracture Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WELLINGTON (Reuters) - England leg-spinner Mason Crane has been ruled out of the rest of the tour of New Zealand and will miss the two tests with a stress fracture of his back, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) have said. Cricket - Ashes test match - Australia v England - SCG, Sydney, Australia, January 5, 2018. England's Mason Crane dives to field the ball during the second day of the fifth Ashes cricket test match. REUTERS/David Gray/Files The 21-year-old Crane, who made his debut in the fifth Ashes test in Sydney in January, felt discomfort in his back earlier this week and had two scans, which revealed a partial stress fracture, the ECB said in a statement. He will return home and be replaced by left-arm spinner Jack Leach. Crane had figures of 1-193 on debut and with New Zealand pitches rarely favouring spin, probably would not have been in contention for either of the matches. The opening game from March 22 is New Zealandâ€™s first day-night test, with the second match at Hagley Oval in Christchurch from March 30. Reporting by Greg Stutchbury; Editing by John O'Brien
